header.heading: Account
header.description: Manage your account settings, including access changes, security, and deactivation options.
header.securityDescription: Set up two-factor authentication and auto-renewals for enhanced protection of your data.
header.deactivationDescription: If you want to temporarily or permanently disable your account, use this option. Be aware of the consequences.

email.heading: Email Address
email.verifiedText: Thank you for verifying your email.
email.notVerifiedText: Please verify your email to avoid any issues.

password.heading: Account Password
password.oldPasswordDescription: Enter your old password to verify your identity before changing your password. This is necessary to ensure the security of your account.
password.newPasswordDescription: Your new password must be at least 8 characters long. It is recommended to use special characters for added security.

twoFactor.heading: TOTP Authentication
twoFactor.description: Enhance your account security by enabling TOTP authentication. This additional layer of protection requires entering a unique code, making your account less vulnerable to unauthorized access.

deactivation.heading: Account Deactivation
deactivation.description: After deactivating your account, you will not be able to log in. Your account will be completely deleted after {deletionDays} days. Until then, you can contact support to restore access and unlock your account.

confirmModal.heading: Deactivation Confirmation
confirmModal.message: Are you sure you want to deactivate your account? Access can only be restored within {deletionDays} days.

header.description: Configure how you want to receive notifications from Elcast. You will receive notifications about the start of streams on the channels you are subscribed to, as well as about new followers.

instructionModal.description: To start sharing your content with your audience, follow this step-by-step guide to connecting OBS Studio. Just a few steps, and you're ready to go live!
instructionModal.step1Title: üîë Step 1: Download OBS Studio and Generate Server URL and Stream Key
instructionModal.step1Description: To start streaming, you need two key elements: Server URL and Stream Key. Follow these steps:
instructionModal.downloadObsDescription: Before setting up your stream, download and install the program
instructionModal.copyKeys: Copy Server URL and Stream Key
instructionModal.copyKeysDescription: Once generated, you will see two fields: Server URL and Stream Key. Click the copy icons next to each field to save them to your clipboard.
instructionModal.step2Description: Now that you have the required data, let‚Äôs set up OBS to work with your stream:
instructionModal.openObsDescription: If OBS is not installed yet, download it from the official site and install it. Once launched, the main OBS page will open.
instructionModal.openStreamSettingsDescription: In the top menu, click ‚ÄúFile‚Äù ‚Üí ‚ÄúSettings.‚Äù Go to the ‚ÄúStream‚Äù tab.
instructionModal.enterDetailsDescription: In the 'Service' field, select 'Custom...'. Paste the previously copied Server URL into the 'URL' field. In the 'Stream Key' field, enter your Stream Key.
instructionModal.saveSettingsDescription: Click 'Apply' and then 'OK' to save the changes.
instructionModal.step3Description: After successfully setting up OBS, you‚Äôre ready to start a live broadcast:
instructionModal.startStreamDescription: Return to the main OBS screen and click the 'Start Streaming' button.
instructionModal.monitorStreamDescription: Your stream will begin in real-time, and you can monitor it both on the platform and in OBS.
instructionModal.congrats: ‚ú® Congratulations! You've successfully set up OBS for streaming on our platform. Your audience awaits new exciting moments and content! üéâ
